content.explanation: Numbers can be compared to find which is greater or smaller. We use symbols like > (greater than), < (less than), and = (equal to) for comparison.
keyPoints: Numbers can be compared using place value
The number with more digits is usually greater
Use > for greater than and < for less than

content.explanation: Large numbers are written using place value system. We use commas to separate periods like ones, thousands, lakhs, and crores.
keyPoints: Indian system uses lakhs and crores
International system uses millions and billions
Place value helps in reading large numbers

content.explanation: A number line is a straight line with numbers placed at equal intervals. It helps visualize numbers and operations.
keyPoints: Numbers increase from left to right

content.explanation: Whole numbers have special properties like closure, commutative, and associative properties for addition and multiplication.
keyPoints: Closure: Sum of two whole numbers is a whole number

content.explanation: A factor divides a number completely. A multiple is obtained by multiplying a number by any whole number.
keyPoints: Every number is a factor of itself
1 is a factor of every number

content.explanation: Prime numbers have exactly two factors: 1 and the number itself. Composite numbers have more than two factors.
keyPoints: Every composite number can be expressed as product of primes

content.explanation: A point is an exact location. A line is a collection of points extending infinitely in both directions. Shapes are formed by lines and curves.
An angle is formed when two rays meet at a common point called vertex. Angles are measured in degrees.
A fraction represents a part of a whole. It has a numerator (top) and denominator (bottom).
Fractions can be added, subtracted, multiplied, and divided. Like fractions have the same denominator.
keyPoints: Add/subtract like fractions by adding/subtracting numerators
For unlike fractions, find LCM of denominators
Multiply fractions by multiplying numerators and denominators
